comment: Out of a scale of 1-10, professor Kemelmakher is an 11. He's an easy grader and very lenient with due dates. He WANTS you to succeed. I really enjoyed having him as a professor during my time at KSU.

Professor Kemelmakher is an amazing professor, and IT 3503 is one of the easiest courses I have ever taken. There was not a lot of coding involved except for one assignment which he ended up waiving due to technical issues. The class is really just a lot of theory. If you struggle with him as your professor, you are (most likely) the problem.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: No textbook available. Said he didn't expect students to be able to complete the work he gave. Brags of "open notes" but expected detailed answers when the powerpoints are vague. Only know of 1 student who seemed to have no issues. Responsive & quick to grade, but that doesn't mean much when students continued to receive unhelpful, rude responses.

You are graded on very few things, that are super easy. The tests are all open note and come straight from the PowerPoints, which you are allowed to quote on the tests. Open ended tests, no tricks. I think I have a 99.8% in the class and I have barely spent any time on this class. I was nervous because it was an IT class, it is so easy.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. Kemelmakher is so nice! I've taken him for two different HIT courses. He really cares about the students and will do all he can to make sure you pass.
Great teacher with good feedback. grading criteria is clear and tests are open book
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is too much and expected everything they way do.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Took this class online and he was very understand about my situation that required me to not do work during the date. I would take him, hes very responsive, and seems to be an all around cool guy. 3 tests, with the final taking about 20% of your grade, nice system!

Easy teacher, in my opinion. Even though the examination are more theory based and not physical hands on or code based examination. Exams are proctored. Quizes are minimum and just the right amount of homework. Really liked working with this professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Easy class and teacher, quizzes were 5 questions and you got 3 tries. Assignments were simple and even if you made mistakes he would give 100% for the effort. Some simple discussion posts and 1 project which wasn't too bad. If anyone makes below a B in this class then college isn't for you.
